intro: Poacynum armenum, commonly known as Armenian grass. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils and sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence, while the flowers are usually greenish-yellow in color. Poacynum armenum is notable for its adaptability to harsh climates and is found primarily in the Caucasus and parts of Central Asia.
